titles.title: Keep Gulf Coast Families Healthy Act of 2005
To allow a deduction for 100 percent of medical expenses, not compensated for by insurance or otherwise, for taxpayers residing in the Hurricane Katrina disaster area.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 10/7/2005--Introduced. Keep Gulf Coast Families Healthy Act of 2005 - Waives until December 31, 2010, the limitation on the tax deduction for medical expenses (i.e., only expenses exceeding 7.5% of adjusted gross income are deductible) for taxpayers residing in the Hurricane Katrina disaster area on August 28, 2005.
